intro: Johnstonella grayi var. nesiotica, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, while its flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. The species is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh, mountainous environments.
